segments.text: I'm just watching this woman, and I can't believe it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She is literally standing in a puddle of water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The faucet is on full blast, and the sink is overflowing dramatically.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can a person be so utterly blind to their surroundings?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me furious to see such a lack of basic awareness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her expression is so calm, so completely neutral.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's just polishing that plate as if nothing else exists.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Meanwhile, her kitchen is turning into a mini-lake.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And her children are up to no good right behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's missing everything important happening in her own home.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's not just a minor spill; this is a significant water incident.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone needs to tell her to turn off the tap!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her obliviousness is just beyond frustrating to witness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a surge of irritation just looking at her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This level of detachment is quite shocking.
segments.speaker: PAR
